meanings.definition: A person who is clumsy or awkward.
meanings.sent1: The new student was a real padnag in the school play, tripping over their own feet.
meanings.sent2: The padnag bumped into the door while trying to leave the room.
meanings.sent3: The padnag tried to juggle but ended up dropping all the balls on their own head.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves were like a padnag trying to navigate through a crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The padnag's attempts at balancing on the beam were both comical and endearing.

meanings.sent1: She padnagged across the stage, almost tripping on her shoelaces.
meanings.sent2: The toddler padnagged around the room, knocking over toys in their path.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to padnag gracefully on the ice but kept slipping and sliding.
meanings.sent4: The robot padnagged through the maze of wires, struggling to find its way out.
meanings.sent5: The bear tried to padnag through the narrow cave entrance, getting stuck halfway.

meanings.definition: A clumsy or awkward action or movement.
meanings.sent1: The padnag of the vase falling off the table echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: Her sudden padnag caused her to spill the drink all over herself.
meanings.sent3: The padnag of the cat knocking over the plant startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The padnag of the car swerving off the road was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The padnag of the book slipping from her hands made her cheeks turn red.
